alert.note: Alert for Lee (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 16 at 1:21PM CDT by NWS Birmingham
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Lee County through 200 PM CDT... At 120 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Auburn University, or over Auburn, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Auburn, Opelika, Beauregard, Beans Mill, Auburn University, Loachapoka, Robert G. Pitts Airport, Chewacla State Park and Mount Jefferson. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
